required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase III Study to Determine Efficacy of Durvalumab in Stage II-III Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) After Curative Intent Therapy.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Multicenter, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of Durvalumab for the Treatment of Stage II-III NSCLC Patients With Minimal Residual Disease Following Surgery and Curative Intent Therapy.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase III double-blind, placebo-controlled study of Durvalumab versus Placebo in patients with stage II-III NSCLC who are MRD-positive following curative intent therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase III, randomized, multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled, study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of durvalumab adjuvant therapy compared to placebo in patients with completely resected stage II-III NSCLC who have undergone curative intent therapy (complete resection ± neoadjuvant and/or adjuvant therapy), who have no evidence of Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) Version 1.1-defined disease recurrence, and who become MRD+ during a 96-week surveillance period.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: DFS in PD-L1 TC≥1% (using Investigator assessments according to RECIST 1.1)
primary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo as measured by DFS in the PD-L1 TC≥1% analysis set

secondary_outcome.measure: DFS in FAS (using Investigator assessments according to RECIST 1.1)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo as measured by DFS in all randomized patients
To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo on post-recurrence outcomes
To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo on post-recurrence outcomes
To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo on post-recurrence outcomes

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in EORTC QLQ-C30
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning, and HRQoL in patients treated with durvalumab compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in EORTC QLQ-LC13
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning,and HRQoL in patients treated with durvalumab compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to deterioration in EORTC QLQ-C30
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning, and HRQoL in patients treated with durvalumab compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to deterioration in EORTC QLQ-LC13
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning,and HRQoL in patients treated with durvalumab compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: IHC analysis of PD-L1 TC expression and spatial distribution within the tumor microenvironment relative to efficacy outcomes (ie, DFS, OS)The Ventana SP263 PD-L1 immunohistochemistry (IHC) assay will be used to determine PDL1 status in all specimens.
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the relationship between a patient's baseline PD-L1 TC expression and efficacy of study treatments

secondary_outcome.measure: DFS (using BICR assessments according to RECIST 1.1) in PD-L1 TC≥1% analysis set
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo as measured by DFS in the PD-L1 TC≥1% analysis set

secondary_outcome.measure: DFS (using BICR assessments according to RECIST 1.1) in FAS
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo as measured by DFS in all randomized patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: OS in PD-L1 TC≥1% analysis set
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo as measured by OS in the PD-L1 TC≥1% analysis set
To assess the efficacy of durvalumab compared to placebo as measured by OS in all randomized patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Capable of giving signed informed consent which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the ICFs and in the protocol.
2. Age ≥18 years at the time of screening (ICF1);
3. Histologically confirmed NSCLC with resectable stage II-III disease
4. Complete resection of the primary NSCLC
Exclusion Criteria:
1. EGFR and/or ALK mutant
2. Mixed small cell and NSCLC histology
3. History of allogeneic organ or bone marrow transplantation
4. History of active primary immunodeficiency

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers can request access to anonymized individual patient-level data from AstraZeneca group of companies sponsored clinical trials via the request portal. All request will be evaluated as per the AZ disclosure commitment: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: AstraZeneca will meet or exceed data availability as per the commitments made to the EFPIA Pharma Data Sharing Principles. For details of our timelines, please rerefer to our disclosure commitment at: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: When a request has been approved AstraZeneca will provide access to the de-identified individual patient-level data in an approved sponsored tool . Signed Data Sharing Agreement (non-negotiable contract for data accessors) must be in place before accessing requested information. Additionally, all users will need to accept the terms and conditions of the SAS MSE to gain access. For additional details, please review the Disclosure Statements at https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
